name: Holiday Inn Express Suites Elizabethtown

reviews.text: This Holiday Express is very new and a great motel. Rooms were nice and clean, and the breakfast was great. But the soundproofing was not good. Whenever someone upstairs took a shower or flushed the toilet, it sounded like the water was coming into our room. Also we could hear snoring from the next room. The shower head was large, their new one they advertise, but we did not like it. Others probably would love it. Would we stay here again? Maybe.
reviews.title: Great motel, some problems
Great Value - Great Stay
reviews.text: Brand new hotel. Stayed for business. DSL in EVERY room - free. Nice cont. breakfast. Clean and friendly staff and great value.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were happy when we first saw this hotel. It appears to be fairly new and is located at the end of a block away from noisy businesses.
reviews.title: PROS and CONS

likes.liked: — There were too many problems to like anything best.
likes.disliked: — Noise from train, Uncomfortable mattress, Painful shower - Unable to sleep well.

reviews.text: very clean and new. easy to get to. the front desk staff was excellent. breakfast was ok-they said they have omlettes and biscuits and gravy, but every other day. apparently we were there on the 'other' day. pool is small, and there is no hot tub. very clean and the suite part was nice. spacious bathroom.
reviews.title: would visit again

likes.liked: — clean, spacious room w/microwave, sink and refrigerator

reviews.text: I travelled to this hotel with my husband and 2 children aged 7 and 11. The hotel is new, and clean. The rooms are spacious. The beds are really comfortable. The dining/breakfast area is very reasonable in price and similar to a restaurant. My kids ate free for all meals. All the decor is modern and attractive. The pool is clean and a great size. I stayed at the Sofitel, Manhatten, NY the previous weekend and both hotels were almost similar, except the holiday inn was about $400 cheaper! I would highly recommed this hotel for families or anyone who likes a clean comfortabe hotel with friendly staff.
reviews.title: A great hotel

reviews.text: Everything said about this location is correct. It's clean, everything works, expanded cable and fast internet. Upon checking in I asked for a trainside room. You cannot see the tracks in the summer but most likely in the winter. There is no railroad crossing so no horn blowing. It's funny, think about the trip that Lucy, Dezi, Fred and Ethel took when they stayed overnight at a motel by the tracks.....the room started to shake and their beds slid across the floor. Well folks it's not quite that bad here - and I'm sure it depends on the day of the week. Just like truck traffic, the lightest days for both is sat, sun & mon.
reviews.title: Quiet until 10pm

likes.liked: — clean room, comfortable bed, expanded cable, cont. breakfast, friendly employees, pet friendly

reviews.text: Ok the rooms are quiet side to side and overhead. Things were calm up until 10pm and then it started and it was friday night. One train after another, constant - and at times it sounded like two trains at once going opposite directions. You hear a rumble -like a small earthquake and thats about it, but how would you know if not told in advance. This is a busy railroad operated by CSX between Louisville & Nashville (formerly the L&N).
reviews.title: Best Hotel in Elizabethtown

likes.liked: — Kristie, the front desk employee...she made our stay wonderful!

reviews.title: comfortable
reviews.text: I did sleep soundly, its not as bad as hearing a roaring car, or a boom boom radio. I will take the train rumble over the others anyday. If I was in the area I certainly would stay here again.

aka: Holiday Inn Express Suites Elizabethtown Hotel Elizabethtown
description: Located in the heart of Elizabethtown, KY, is the Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites, conveniently located off I-65 at exit 94. This beautiful property is within walking distance of several resturants. The property is located minutes away from the new Elizabethtown Sports Park and Fort Knox. The property opened May 1st, 2005; however, it is well maintained featuring several upgrades. Only a thirty minute drive from Kentucky Derby, Churchill Downs, Makers Mark Distillery, Jim Beam Distillery, My Old KY Home, and Louisville Fair and Exposition Center. Nearby is the Towne Mall with over 53 stores and Movie Palace Theater with stadium seating. The hotel offers 76 spacious guest rooms that include Kings, Double Queens, King Suites, Jacuzzi Rooms and Kid Suites and a banquet room that will accommodate 150. free high speed internet, complimentary deluxe continental breakfast, fitness center and free morning paper. Nearby businesses including Accumetric, Akebono, CDR, Fort Knox Army Base, Metalsa, UPS and Fort Knox National. All rates are based on double occupancy. Pets are accepted with a $50.00 non-refundable cleaning fee due at check in. Rollaway beds and cribs are available on a first-come, first-serve basis. All rooms include a refrigerator, microwave, flat screen / HD tv with a host of premium channels.
